results.title: Sport parade: big fish
results.creator_credit: Eugene W. Castle and Castle Films
results.brief_description: Covers tuna fishing in the Mediterranean (by netting); sail fishing in the Gulf Stream - East Coast of Florida; netting salmon; and shows whales (mammals of the sea) in the South Pacific. Narrated by Clyde Kittel.

results.title: Sport in Australia
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Cinesound
results.brief_description: A review of sports - tennis, golf, cricket, swimming, athletics. In all these fields Australia has produced a consistent line of champions - Adrian Quist, Kel Nagle, Sir Donald Bradman, Dawn Frazer, John Landy. Sport is an integral part of school education where natural talent combine with sound teaching to produce future champions. Australian Rules Football is the most popular spectator sport.

results.title: Sport beams: let's go fishing
results.brief_description: A war time sport related newsreel showcasing some of the more active sides of fishing, particularly deep sea fishing. Commentary remains bright and jolly whilst footage of whales being harpooned pass by the screen.

results.title: Sponges and coelenterates: porous and sac-like animals
results.brief_description: Studies the life cycle of sponges and coelenterates, the simplest multicellular animals. Describes the cell specialisation, sexual and asexual reproduction, and other characteristics of sponges, jellyfish, sea anemones, corals and hydras. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Split Enz: 1972-1992
results.brief_description: Spanning a musical career of 20 years this tape contains music clips for the following Split Enz songs; “Late last night”, “Sweet dreams”, “Lovey dovey”, “Bold as brass”, “My mistake”, “I see red”, “Give it a whirl”, “I hope I never”, “I got you”, “One step ahead”, “History never repeats”, “I don’t wanna dance”, Six months in a leaky boat”, “Dirty creature”, “Never ceases to amaze me”, Next exit”, “Message to my girl”, “Strait old line”, and “I Walk away”.

results.title: Splendours of Britain
results.creator_credit: John Abbott, Robert Angell and British Tourist Authority
results.brief_description: An introduction to the heraldry and pageantry of Great Britain. Shows the work involved in creating a coat of arms; Salisbury Cathedral; the Queen and Knights of the Thistle attending a service at St. Giles; Trooping the Colours; scenes of country-side and cities.

results.title: Splash [Greek version]
results.brief_description: A home swimming pool, an accidental drowning, a distraught and helpless mother. Such tragedies can be prevented. A poolside seminar demonstrates the dangers and the means of avoiding them, emphasising the need for awareness and the knowledge of basic methods of resuscitation. In Greek language only.

MPEG-4 Digital File; ACMI Digital Access Copy - overscan

results.title: Spirogyra: structure and life functions
results.brief_description: The unaided eye sees Spirogyra as green masses of slimy intertwining filaments. The microscope reveals detailed cellular structures, including nucleus, cytoplasm, chloroplasts and pyrenoids - the length and diameter of a spirogyra cell, and in a culture we observe growth and sexual reproduction.

results.title: Spirit of the Tall Ships
results.brief_description: SPIRIT OF THE TALL SHIPS traces the historical voyage of the Polish Tall Ship, Dar Mlodziezy and the USA Coast Guard’s Egle to Australia, and the adventures of four young Australians who took part in these epic journeys.
